page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The farms in the area are: Temple Farm Fossett's Farm, Shopland Hall, Beuachamps Farm and part of Sutton Hall. The first three are owned by Alec Steele and Co. whilst the other two are owned by Tabor Farms. There was no co-operation received from the farmers despite questionaires being sent to them. From observation the main crop on the farm land would appear to be oil seed rape. Other crops are barley, wheat, potatoes and peas. Farm machinery is very much in evidence, e.g. the potato harvester has taken the place of hand pickers. The crops do not rely wholly on rainfall but also piped water with spray attatchments. There are many signposted footpaths but on investigation these were no longer in existence as farmers had planted crops over them.
